opendial.bn.distribs

Class ConditionalDistribution<T extends IndependentProbDistribution>

  • java.lang.Object
    • opendial.bn.distribs.ConditionalDistribution<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ProbDistribution
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConditionalTable

    public class ConditionalDistribution<T extends IndependentProbDistribution>
extends java.lang.Object
implements ProbDistribution
    Conditional probability distribution represented as a probability table. The table expresses a generic distribution of type P(X|Y1...Yn), where X is called the "head" random variable, and Y1...Yn the conditional random variables..

    This class represent a generic conditional distribution in which the distribution for the head variable X can be represented using arbitrary distributions of type T.

    Version:
    $Date:: $
    Author:
    Pierre Lison (plison@ifi.uio.no)

      • sample

        public Value sample(Assignment condition)
             throws DialException
        Sample a head assignment from the distribution P(head|condition), given the condition. If no assignment can be sampled (due to e.g. an ill-formed distribution), returns an empty assignment.
        Specified by:
        sample in interface ProbDistribution
        Parameters:
        condition - the condition
        Returns:
        the sampled assignment
        Throws:
        DialException - if the sample could not be extracted given the condition

      • getProb

        public double getProb(Assignment condition,
                      Value head)
               throws DialException
        Returns the probability of the head assignment given the conditional assignment. The method assumes that the posterior distribution has a discrete form.
        Specified by:

      • getValues

        public java.util.Set<Value> getValues(ValueRange range)
        Returns all possible values specified in the table. The input values are here ignored (for efficiency reasons), so the method simply extracts all possible head rows in the table.
        Specified by:
        getValues in interface ProbDistribution
        Parameters:
        range - the input values (is ignored)
        Returns:
        the possible values for the head variables.

      • isWellFormed

        public boolean isWellFormed()
        Returns true if the probability table is well-formed. The method checks that all possible assignments for the condition and head parts are covered in the table, and that the probabilities add up to 1.0f.
        Specified by:
        isWellFormed in interface ProbDistribution
        Returns:
        true if the table is well-formed, false otherwise
